params.name: scheduleId
params.doc: The schedule ID for which availability is checked.

docs.summary:
Returns availability for a given schedule ID
The availability for a course is calculated by:
- Checking for total spots by the schedule's capacity
- Checking for open spots by subtracting the current number of participants from the total spots
* current number of participants is calculated by summing the number of participants of all bookings booked to the schedule
Returns the availability for a given slot.
description:
A slot for an appointment does not have a `sessionId. Only a slot for a class has a `sessionId`.

Availability for an appointment is calculated as follows:
- Checking for available slots in the calendar, and calculating the open spots
- Checking for existing bookings with overlapping time, service & resource, where the booked session has transparency set to  `"BUSY"`  When the booking is in the process of being checked out, it may not have a sessionId yet. In this case it is considered as `"BUSY"`.
- Checking for booking policy violations in the services-catalog.
The following fields are required to get the availability for an appointment:
- `startDate`
- `endDate`
- `serviceId`
- `resourceId`
- `scheduleId`
Availability for classes is calculated as follows:
- Checking for total spots by the session's capacity
- Checking for open spots by subtracting the current number of participants from the total spots
- Checking for booking policy violations in the services-catalog
- Checking for a waiting list and its occupancy in the waiting-list
- Checking for locked in the locks
For a class, the following fields are required:
- `sessionId`

docs.summary:
Returns availability entries, describing service availability for booking given the query constraints.
Query object support:
- **filter**: supports
- `startDate`: Query range start time. Formatted according to RFC3339. When optional timezone field present, will be treated as local-date-time (timezone offset in the format is ignored). Required.
- `endDate`: Query range end time. Formatted according to RFC3339. When optional timezone field present, will be treated as local-date-time (timezone offset in the format is ignored). Required. // define time span limit and default
- `serviceId`: A list of one or more service ids.
- `resourceId`: A list of one or more resource ids (staff ids). Optional.
- `bookable`: When set, only entries with corresponding bookable values will be returned. Optional. When absent, both bookable and non-bookable slots are returned.
- `bookingPolicyViolations.tooEarlyToBook`: When set, only entries with corresponding tooEarlyToBook values will be returned. Optional.
- `bookingPolicyViolations.tooLateToBook`: When set, only entries with corresponding tooLateToBook values will be returned. Optional.
- `location.businessLocation.id`: Filter by `location.business_location.id`. Supports multiple values. Optional.
- `openSpots`: Filter by amount of `openSpots`. Supports 'gte' only. Optional.
- **fields**: supported.
- **paging**: Paging is supported using CursorPaging. For paging the results, i.e. with a page size of 10, set the `query.cursorPaging.limit` to a value of `10`.
The response will contain a value in the `pagingMetadata.cursors.next` field.
Pass this value in the `query.cursorPaging.cursor` field in the following calls and leave the `query` field empty.
- **fieldsets**: not supported.
description:
> Note about timezone DST gaps
> Local date time is not defined in cases where DST is started or ended.
> For example September 5th 2021, 00:05, is not defined in Santiago, Chile, because at 00:00 the clock moved
> 1 hour forward to 01:00.
> In such cases, automatic remediation will be applied - the wrong local date time will be forwarded by 1 hour.
> For example, if QueryAvailability is called with startDate = 2021-09-05T00:00:01.000, endDate = 2021-09-06T00:00:01.000,
> automatic remediation will be applied to the corrupted startDate, and 2021-09-05T01:00:01.000-2021-09-05T00:00:01.000
> will be queried instead. Notice that only startDate is shifted one hour forward, and endDate is not adjusted, since it is defined.

members.name: maxParticipantsPerBooking
members.doc: Booking policy settings for a given Slot/Schedule

members.name: bookOnlineDisabled
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Online booking is disabled for this slot.

members.name: tooEarlyToBook
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Too early to book this slot.

members.name: tooLateToBook
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Too late to book this slot.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The schedule ID for which availability is checked.

members.name: slot
members.doc: The slot for which the availability is checked.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone for which availability is to be calculated.

members.name: slot
members.doc: The slot for which the availability is checked.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone for which availability is to be calculated.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Business Location ID. Present if the location is a business location.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
One of:
- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the siteâ€™s general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: query
members.doc: Partially supported. See description above.

members.name: slotsPerDay
members.doc:
Maximum number of slots to load per date. For example, when given the value 3,
at most 3 available slot are returned for each day in the requested date range.
When a day has both bookable and non-bookable slots, bookable slots are returned first.
Non-bookable slots are returned according to the specified filters, after all bookable slots are already included.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone for which availability slots are to be calculated.

members.name: query
members.doc: Partially supported. See description above.

members.name: slotsPerDay
members.doc:
Maximum number of slots to load per date. For example, when given the value 3,
at most 3 available slot are returned for each day in the requested date range.
When a day has both bookable and non-bookable slots, bookable slots are returned first.
Non-bookable slots are returned according to the specified filters, after all bookable slots are already included.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone for which availability slots are to be calculated.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Indicators of booking policy violations for the given Schedule.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: The end time of this Slot (formatted according to RFC3339). Required.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic location of the slot.

members.name: resource
members.doc: The resource required for this slot. Currently, in Bookings, this is the relevant staff. Required.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule identifier. Required.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service identifier. Required.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: Identifier for underlying session when session is a single session or generated from a recurring session. Required.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: The start time of this Slot (formatted according to RFC3339). Required.

members.name: timezone
members.doc: The timezone according to which the slot is calculated presented.

members.name: bookable
members.doc: Whether this available sot is bookable.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Indicators for booking policy violations for the slot.

members.name: locked
members.doc: Indicates whether this slot is locked.

members.name: openSpots
members.doc: Number of open spots for this availability.

members.name: slot
members.doc: Identifier for underlying session when session is a single session or generated from a recurring session. Required.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots for this availability.
For example, for a class of 10 spots with 3 spots booked, `spotsTotal` is 10, `openSpots` is 7.

members.name: waitingList
members.doc: An object describing the slot's waiting-list and its occupancy.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Resource ID

members.name: name
members.doc: Read only. Resource name.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots and open spots for this waiting list.
For example, a Yoga class of 10 waiting list spots with 3 registered on the waiting list  has total_spots: 10 and open_spots: 7.
